Description: Large bowl of grey schist: with a flat base and incurving rim. The base is countersunk on the interior. The side of the bowl bears two small areas which have been greatly scratched, no doubt deliberately, perhaps in order to remove an incised inscription. Restored from fragments.
Curator's comments: Compare the erased inscriptions on vessels from the tomb of Semerkhet, W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, pls. V, 5; VI, 9-11. See also introduction to inscribed stone vessel fragments (p. 41).
